topic.title: TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology

fig.title: TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology Diagram

image.href: FIG_tcp dp uhbr20 retimer mux with barlow ridge topology diagram_1.png

table.title: TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology Notes

entry.p: To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline route

Ground on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
Nominal 100 nF recommended (75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Retimer MUX RX must be compliant to VESA DisplayPort (DP) Standard version 2.1.
Refer to RDC #736855 for Barlow Ridge guidelines.

section.title: Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Tx, Pre-Channel

table.title: TCP DP UHBR20 Retimer MUX With Barlow Ridge Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines

section.p: Max Length Total Note: The maximum length is based on the assumption that the Retimer MUX RX meets the VESA DisplayPort (DP) standard 2.1. To determine the exact maximum routing length, consult the Retimer Mux vendor.

section.title: Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Tx, Pre-Channel 2
section.p: Max Length Total Note: Note1*: Refer to Retimer/MUX vendor and Barlow Ridge documentation to determine min/max routing length.
